TimingManager.name: TimingManager
TimingManager.description:
Consumes timing information and runs handlers bound to animation
labels.
TimingManager.author: Simon Potter

params.name: timingInfo
params.description:
Timing information, as
exported by the [animaker package](https://github.com/pmur002/animaker) in [R](http://www.r-project.org/). For more information, refer to `?export` in R once animaker has loaded.

params.name: timeUnit
params.description:
Determine what time units the
timing information exported from animaker refers to. Must be one of
`"ms"` (milliseconds), `"s"` (seconds), or `"m"` (minutes).

classitems.description: Registers an action to an animation

params.name: fns
params.description: An object where the keys are the labels for an animation, and the values are a function to register as an action to that animation

params.name: overwrite
params.description: Allows us to overwrite existing actions for animations.

classitems.description: Plays all animations associated with actions
classitems.name: play

params.name: t
params.description: An optional delay (in `timeUnit`s) to add to the entire animation.

classitems.description: Returns all of the timing information about the frames that are to be played at a given time.
classitems.name: frameTiming

params.name: t
params.description: The time in *milliseconds* to select an animation from

return.description: A list of matching animations to play at the current time

classitems.description: Plays all animations associated with actions at a given rate per second.
classitems.name: frameApply

params.name: fps
params.description: How many frames per second are going to be drawn. By default this is 10.

params.name: t
params.description: An optional delay (in `timeUnit`s) to add to the entire animation

warnings.message:
Missing item type
Registers an action to an animation
